data.text: @RasenBran @TaleSpun @seraharcana Much like wanting Dragon Quest to significantly modernize some things are just futile to wish for
@sabuhtoothalex @TaleSpun @seraharcana (Realistically there's probably a lot more going into the long time between stuff other than JUST him that's unfair but still)
@sabuhtoothalex @TaleSpun @seraharcana I just wish the man knew how to use Google Calendar a little bit better
@TaleSpun @RasenBran @seraharcana pretty excited at the prospect of having Big Dick Nomura here again with back to back hot games
@TaleSpun @sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana No Ron there's a completely finished cut of versus 13 out there that the man doesn't want us to see
@seraharcana @RasenBran @sabuhtoothalex Yuffie: “FUCK CLOUD!!”
@RasenBran @sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana https://t.co/A69GWyThtv

@seraharcana @sabuhtoothalex @TaleSpun Cloud: "Jenova...."
Sephiroth: WHY DID YOU SAY THAT?

@sabuhtoothalex @RasenBran @seraharcana Yeah, he’s frustrated me greatly (and semi-famously lol) for years now, but despite everything, it actually really truly seems like KH3 is gonna deliver, which does a lot for his image in my book.
@sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana @TaleSpun Justice league* DC movies are the same it's ok

@sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana @TaleSpun What we really need is a petition for the Nomura Cut 

Just like bvs
@RasenBran @seraharcana @TaleSpun oh weirdo half measures games like Type-0 and FFXV are. Whether that'll be a GOOD vision or not remains to be seen but I'm pretty optimistic.

@RasenBran @seraharcana @TaleSpun I have no real reason to but I honestly have a surprising amount of faith in Nomura for this specific game. He has been ruminating on what this game, and VsXIII before it, could be for a long time. I'm pretty confident there will be a clear vision from him here and not the kind
@RasenBran @sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana Like, when KH3 is actually out and in people’s hands, I think that impacts the VII-R excitement in a big way.

@RasenBran @sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana I think, when he can actually get shit done, Nomura actually has a vision that breeds some pretty great combat. FFXV I think is a bastion for trying to please all sides and pleasing none as a result.
@sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana @TaleSpun -because the idea of this maybe being a bit more of a reigned in KH could be super cool if they do materia right but I'll just have to wait and see

@sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana @TaleSpun I think main thing is it doesn't - at least so far - feel like a new coat of paint. It still feels like it's been using that paint we've been splashing on stuff since Type-0 if that makes sense

It sounds like they're trying to find happy medium between styles and I hope they do-
@seraharcana @RasenBran I kind of fell off of it, but that combat really is VERY cool.

@TaleSpun @seraharcana @RasenBran And what little they've said about the way Cloud is going to be characterized this time around has me suuuuuper excited. And it's pretty unlikely we'll get a loc as botched as the original lol
@RasenBran @seraharcana I just thought you were making fun of nerds. UWU

@sabuhtoothalex @seraharcana @RasenBran I’m *very*!into seeing what he wants to do with KH combat when it’s not shackled to Disney characters. And I actually like Advebt Children more than most people as well, so I dig that aesthetic.
@seraharcana @TaleSpun "impwessive" fuck me

@seraharcana @TaleSpun But even then, I think that going for the safer, more generic this g they've been going for there's room for them to... actually try to remind people what was great about the thing they fell in love with in the first place
@seraharcana @TaleSpun @RasenBran play something that isn't just the same game with a new coat of paint.

@seraharcana @TaleSpun @RasenBran Tbh I'm glad they're going the direction they are with VII-R. I don't think it'll matter much to most of the casual people who played it back in the day and pick it up again now. As a big fan of the original there are things I'll be a stickler for in the remake but I'm so down to
@seraharcana @RasenBran Yeah, I think this is definitely best anticipated as “FFVII as Nomura sees it”. That’s a very specific take I think.

@seraharcana @TaleSpun I think there's still a lot of anxiety that ATB/Turn-based gameplay isn't technically impwessive enough to be marketed anymore

Like I think there's lots of us (me included) who prefer turn based but sadly I think the average person who buys games still thinks of it as outdated
@TaleSpun will always raise eyebrows to reviews very enthusiastic about jrpgs being anything but

@seraharcana @RasenBran There’s this pervasive belief that people are just not into turn-based combat, but there’s honestly more working against that idea than supporting it. P5 and Octopath became multimillion sellers with relative ease. Maybe “no is buying turn-based games” because… there are none???
@seraharcana @RasenBran I think VII-R is probably going to be the Kingdom Hearts successor Versus was supposed to be, which I’m totally into, but I do get you.

@seraharcana @RasenBran Yeah, definitely. I think they’re starting to get that westerners actually do like the eastern elements of games. People like actual aesthetic and good movement and interesting combat. For all the jokes we make, people like anime, too.

@RasenBran @seraharcana And I think stuff like P5 and Nier shows the modern way to handle this stuff isn’t with bombastic, expensive marketing, but just putting the games in people’s hands and generating good word of mouth.

@RasenBran @seraharcana Yeah, I think at this point it’s because JRPGs are maybe the closest thing to where horror movies are for quite a while. It’s genre fair that people want - not in huge numbers, but they want it. And publishers are just now getting that.

@seraharcana @TaleSpun I feel like we've been in a weird space for five years now of indie/lower-budget JRPG throwbacks that have been trying that to varying degrees of success but like 

None of them are willing to take lessons from each other

@TaleSpun @seraharcana I don't even know what JRPGs are in the west anymore tbh 

Like all of my old hardcore JRPG friends are too busy Doing A Racism in MOBAs now while my work partner is drawing primrose fanart between meetings and my football-playing ex-coworker at Pizza Hut FB posts his P5 takes
@RasenBran @seraharcana I’d argue FF isn’t really FF in the west anymore (or anywhere else), but I’d keep y’all all night :b

@RasenBran @seraharcana Yeah, it’s just such a weird game to frame the argument around. These games review well and sell moderately (of they’re released in the right period) and that’s OK. It’d be better for basically everyone involved if just accept that DQ is never going to be like FF in the west.
@TaleSpun @seraharcana Ah, yeah I get you. Especially when the referenced movies listed in the piece are international hits and we didn't even get the last mainline DQ here
@seraharcana @RasenBran Apparently you could only toggle for the prologue and had to ultimately choose one mode after that, but it’s still a super cool idea.

@RasenBran @seraharcana that that very idea is the actual albatross around the series neck that holds it back. We have that discussion, it doesn’t sell 10m copies or w/e, and then people have to beg SE online to keep putting them out. It’s a very futile, honestly dumb cycle that repeats.

@RasenBran @seraharcana See, my issue is specifically this idea it fails as a blockbuster. I don’t really care if anyone thinks DQ is boring - on paper, it is. It’s boring as hell for a ton of people and has been for decades. That’s fine. But it isn’t any sort of blockbuster in the west and I think

@seraharcana @RasenBran And the premise here is like a plane that just never gets off the ground because the thing is, viewed in the context of the country where DQ actually is a huge IP (hint: it’s not the US or anywhere in Europe) DQ absolutely delivers on the kind of expectations he’s talking about.

@seraharcana @RasenBran He mentions FFXV too, so I can’t really assume he’s referring to any sort of moderately budgeted titles in the genre. He says himself (in so many terms), it’s not even about the genre, but “intellectual property” and expectation.
@seraharcana @TaleSpun Yeah, you could toggle between the old-school style and HD graphics. I don't think that version is coming here though sadly lol
@seraharcana @TaleSpun (and tbh with some of my beef with the way XV and P5 were executed I'm kinda in the mood for something more traditional ATM too)

@seraharcana @TaleSpun DQ has always been EXTREMELY vanilla so I honestly do think it's fair and tbh I have a hard time selling a lot of people on my love of DQ because of it so this review gave me flashbacks 

I'm just That Guy who really likes vanilla

@RasenBran https://t.co/xn3S6J5SsB

It’s not Waypoint’s finest hour, to say the least.

@sabuhtoothalex It’s just such a weird premise. Like, it reads as though the game was made in Montreal. If you’re gonna use the game to discuss an aspect of the industry you gotta have your info straight. Putting DQ in bed with CoD, BF and arguably FF as well is ignorant on a good day.
@TaleSpun Ron do I even want to know the context here or am I going to be disappointed
@TaleSpun Yeah I wasn't a fan of that piece lol. Outside of the stuff on DQ's treatment of ethnic stereotypes which is super fair.
@TaleSpun you bust blocks in Dragon Quest Builders 2
